data.scheme_name: Karnataka Tourism Policy 2020-26 - Marketing Development Assistance - New
data.benefits: Financial assistance will be provided at 50% of cost of printing/ publishing of publicity material, maximum upto Rs 1 Lakh.
data.eligibility: Entities with specified Tourism Projects registered with the Department of Tourism are eligible under the scheme.
data.conditions: Marketing Development Assistance shall be limited to a maximum of total 25 (twenty-five) Tourism Service Providers in a financial year for each category, with no Tourism Service Provider receiving MDA for more than one category during a financial year.
data.beneficiaries: Entities with specified Tourism Projects registered with the Department of Tourism are eligible under the scheme
data.prerequisites:
Marketing Development Assistance shall be limited to a maximum of total 25 (twenty-five) Tourism Service Providers in a financial year for each category, with no Tourism Service Provider receiving MDA for more than one category during a financial year. 

The Applicant must not have claimed or received any financial assistance for production of publicity material for the said event / fair / exhibition / mart / roadshow / festival / activity or for participation in the said event / fair / exhibition / mart / roadshow / festival / activity from any other Central Government / State Government / Public Sector Undertaking or any other Government Agency in India.

 The Applicant shall not receive Marketing Development Assistance under Karnataka Tourism Policy 2020-26 for more than one category of promotional activity during a financial year.

 Marketing Development Assistance for Participation in Roadshows organized / sponsored by Karnataka Tourism, shall be on a nomination basis only.
data.nodal_agency: Department of Tourism, Government of Karnataka
data.context: To provide a framework for Karnataka’s tourism industry to overcome ongoing difficulties, adapt to new norms, and remain competitive in the global tourism landscape.
data.objective: Karnataka aims to boost tourism for economic growth and employment, ensure visitor safety and comfort, promote globally, enhance infrastructure, attract private investments, and pursue sustainable development aligned with UN goals.
data.description:
Financial assistance will be provided at 50% of cost of printing/ Production of publicity material (Brochure, Product Catalogue, Information Handouts, etc.) for use during festivals / events / activities sponsored or organized by Department of Tourism or its undertakings, maximum up to Rs. 1 Lakh per tourism service provider. Participation in National-level Domestic Event - Financial assistance will be provided at 50% Cost of rental of stall / space at tourism, travel or hospitality related events such as fairs, exhibitions, marts,etc., maximum upto Rs. 30,000 per tourism service provider. Participation in International Event - Financial assistance will be provided at 50% Cost of rental of stall / space at tourism, travel or hospitality related events such as fairs, exhibitions, marts,etc., maximum up to Rs. 60,000 per tourism service provider. 

Participation in Roadshows organized / sponsored by Karnataka Tourism - Financial assistance will be provided at 75% of total fare, for economy class only i.e. (Travel expenses by air from India to any other country and/or by air/rail from one country to another country abroad), maximum upto Rs. 1 lakh per tourism service provider.
data.how_to_apply:
The applicant can apply through the below link:
https://tourismpolicy.karnataka.gov.in/
data.funding_mechanism:
On Final Approval of the Marketing Development Assistance, the Director, Department of Tourism shall transfer the entire sanctioned amount under Marketing Development Assistance to the bank account of the Applicant. 
The disbursal of Marketing Development Assistance shall be done within 15 days of the sanction of the Final Approval, subject to availability of budget. 
Disbursal shall be done on a first-come-first-serve basis as per the date of sanction of Final Approval for Marketing Development Assistance. Disbursal of financial assistance shall be subject to availability of budget.
